intro: Erophila kohlscheidensis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandwort, is a small, flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as sand dunes or rocky outcrops. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, an adaptation to reduce water loss in dry environments. Erophila kohlscheidensis is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar structural and ecological traits.
